title: Ticket #1556: maxLoadFactor is unitialized when using the HashTable copy constructor
description:
When using the HashTable copy constructor maxLoadFactor is left uninitialized. It's then used in needs_resizing() when inserting into the copied HashTable. 
==11935== Conditional jump or move depends on uninitialised value(s)
==11935==    at 0x80FEC24: HashTable<int, int>::needs_resizing() (HashTable.h:643)
==11935==    by 0x80FF755: HashTable<int, int>::addItem(int const&, int const&) (HashTable.h:313)
==11935==    by 0x80FF855: HashTable<int, int>::insert(int const&, int const&) (HashTable.h:285)
check_ins: 2010-Aug-03 16:58   Check-in [18720]: Set maxLoadFactor for a copied HashTable to be the value of maxLoadFactor of the HashTable to copy. (#1556). (By Josh Slauson )
creator: slauson
